channel.title: First sword second model:)!
channel.description:
OK well this is my first sword and my second model i have ever made, i started on this after i posted my shotgun model lol and i finally finished, unfortunately i don't know how to color it. Tell me what you think and constructive criticism, tell me how i can make better models and things i can do to make them look better.
oh this is made out of all prims and i din't trace or any of that bs.
sword [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/153mzxs.jpg[/img]
the hilt and all of that i guess [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/358v24k.jpg[/img]
the sword at a angle [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/mmxdt.jpg[/img]
wire frame of the bottom [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/5l6vyc.jpg[/img]
wire frame of the blade [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/jfg0g9.jpg[/img]
I did all of this work i did not get the idea of a pic, even if there is a pic that could resemble this i thought of the whole sword by myself and made it by myself, and some help from a prim sword guide i red on here a while back and CoonHunter's prim video:)
thanks for looking:)

item.title: First sword second model:)!
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

deans1243:

haha i don’t know how good it would be in a rsps it kinda has allot of stuff into it and the wire frame is kind of messy and i dont know how to make .dats or whatever sorry

i don’t know much about modeling items and such, but if it had a little color it’d be great for a rsps, and its always easy to look up how to make .dats, btw this is meta right? if so i know how to use that a little, i have it at my school. this sword just appeals to me

Read full topic

item.title: First sword second model:)!
item.dc:creator: @Timberpig1 Timberpig.
item.description:
@Timberpig1 wrote:

wow.
really. this is very impressive. i would change some things but thats just because of personal taste. but no really. this is amazing. i see loads of potential for you in the future.
just wow i dont think i’v ever seen a new modeler ever make something so nice.
i love the idea.
poly overkill but you’re still new so thats expected.
come CC
clean up your workflow and continue making awesome models:D

Read full topic

item.title: First sword second model:)!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

deans1243:

[quote]Manipulate your primitives more

Mind explaining to me? sorry i just want to get better at this.

You should have only used up to 4 segmented rectangles in the pummel, instead of 8. This would have made your model cleaner. Look in my video with how I used the segment and knife tools again. That’s really the main flaw i see in this model.

yea the first time i watched your vid it looked like it can help allot but i couldn’t figure out what you were doing, with changing the numbers then clicking ok and it moves the blade for you i can’t figure that out, but ill watch it again and probably a couple more times haha

anyways thanks for the help guys, any suggestions on what i should do next? pleas nothing to hard.[/quote]
Don’t worry about the numbers, all that is, is moving something to an exact amount. I only use that because I like my things to be perfect. You will notice, in the video, I will move something and bring it back a couple times every so often. This is so I can get the exact look I want.

Read full topic

yea the first time i watched your vid it looked like it can help allot but i couldn’t figure out what you were doing, with changing the numbers then clicking ok and it moves the blade for you i can’t figure that out, but ill watch it again and probably a couple more times haha

anyways thanks for the help guys, any suggestions on what i should do next? pleas nothing to hard.

item.title: First sword second model:)!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

deans1243:

i tried to make it as cool as i could lol, is it good?? any suggestions for future models or anything??

To be honest, I’m not a modeler at all. Therefore, I do not know a thing about modeling. However, I suppose adding some color to it wouldn’t hurt. Then again, that might be a horrible idea for this model. So I’m afraid I don’t have advice.

Read full topic
